2.text: Cut your shirt ½ inch (1.27 centimeters) longer than you want it to be.

3.text: Fold the hem up by ½ inch (1.27 centimeters).

4.text: Press the hem flat with an iron.

5.text: Secure the hem with sewing pins.

6.text: Sew as close to the raw edge as you can using a zigzag stitch or a stretch stitch.

7.text: Snip off any excess or loose threads.

8.text: Figure out how short you want your shirt to be, and make a mark on the outside of the shirt.

9.text: Use a dressmaker's chalk or pen to draw a line all around the shirt at an even distance from the bottom edge.

10.text: Fold the hem up until the bottom edge touches the line that you drew.

11.text: Sew around shirt, as close to the selvage edge as you can.

12.text: Fold hem back down, and tuck the excess fabric inside the shirt, away from the bottom of the hem.

13.text: Press the hem with an iron.

14.text: Top stitch as close to your seam as possible.

15.text: Turn the shirt inside-out and cut the excess material away.

17.text: Figure out how long you want your shirt to be, and make a mark ½ inch (1.27 centimeters) below it.

18.text: Use a dressmaker's chalk or pen to draw a line all around bottom of shirt, using the mark as a guide.

19.text: Draw another line ½ inch (1.27 centimeters) below it, and cut along that second line.

20.text: Fold the bottom edge of the shirt upwards, using the first line that you drew as a guide.

21.text: Press the hem flat with an iron.

22.text: Fold hem up by another ½ inch (1.27 centimeters) again, and press it flat with an iron.

23.text: Secure the hem with sewing pins, then sew as close to top edge of hem as you can using a straight stitch.

24.text: Snip off any excess or loose bits of thread.

25.text: Get some single-fold bias tape that closely matches the color of your shirt.

26.text: Cut your shirt a little bit longer than you want it to be.

27.text: Unfold one edge of the tape, and pin it to the bottom edge of your shirt.

28.text: Sew the bias tape to your shirt using a straight stitch.

29.text: Fold the bias tape to the inside of your shirt.

30.text: Press the hem flat with an iron.

31.text: Tuck the excess bias tape into the hem, and press it flat with an iron.

32.text: Secure everything in place with sewing pins, then sew the bias tape down using a straight stitch.

33.text: Give the shirt hem a final press, and snip off any excess or loose threads.
